thread.title: Asia shares rise on Fed outlook as PBOC keeps rates intact: Market down
thread.title_full: Asia shares rise on Fed outlook as PBOC keeps rates intact: Market down

author: Shawn Johnson
title: Asia shares rise on Fed outlook as PBOC keeps rates intact: Market down
text:
(Bloomberg) — Asian shares were mostly higher on Friday after traders bet on a Federal Reserve interest rate cut this year. China shares erased earlier losses as investors ignored the central bank's decision to keep the key policy rate on hold.
Most read from Bloomberg
MSCI Asia Pacific share indexes rose for a third session on Friday after a surprise drop in U.S. producer prices prompted fears the Fed will reduce borrowing costs in coming months.
China's benchmark CSI 300 index erased losses after falling as much as 0.7% earlier when the People's Bank of China held the rate on its one-year policy loan – called a medium-term lending facility – at 2.5%. This was contrary to economists' expectation that it would be cut by 10 basis points.
Japanese shares rose after both the Topix and Nikkei 225 indexes hit 34-year highs last week amid an influx of foreign investors. Shares in Taiwan rose after the Democratic Progressive Party won the presidential election and the more China-friendly Kuomintang gained just enough seats to control the assembly.
US stock futures in Asia were little changed after the S&P 500 closed with modest gains on Friday. US markets are closed on Monday due to holiday.
The dollar was mixed while Treasury 10-year futures were little changed. There is no cash transaction in the Treasury due to holidays in America.
Shares of Baidu Inc fell the most in more than a year after a report linked its Ernie AI platform to major Chinese military research into artificial intelligence.
Oil was little changed as the threat that airstrikes by the US and allies against the Houthis would spark a wider conflict and disrupt the flow of crude from the Middle East was balanced by softness in fundamentals.

shares
